intro: Mycetia ovatistipulata, commonly known as the broad-leaf mycetia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its ovate leaves with prominent stipules, which are leaf-like structures at the base of the petiole. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences, typical of the legume family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Mycetia ovatistipulata is valued for its ornamental foliage and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
